relationships.evidence_text: Welcome to the Y on Earth Community Podcast. I'm your host, Aaron William Perry.
And today we're visiting in Mondragon, Spain with my friend Ander.
Ander, it's Eberia Ota-Duyi at the Mondragon cooperatives.
Ander, Eberia Ota-Duyii is head of cooperative dissemination in Mondragon for eight years.
He serves annually approximately 2,000 people who want to know about the Mondragon cooperative experience.
And he explains and shares with incredible expertise the Mondragon to different universities and forums all around the world.
Previously, he worked in one of the cooperatives of the Mondragon corporation called Eker-Lon Technology Center as a personnel manager.
And before that, he was at the corporate center of Mondragon in training for seven years.
He studied technical engineering at Mondragon University.
and also sociology at the Dess to University in Bilbao.
And so here we are at Ota-Lon, which is one of the very important hubs of the entire Mondragon ecosystem.
We are 80 cooperatives, the cooperatives are in the Basque country.
Then we have subsidiaries around the world, more than 80 in United States, in China, in France, in Brazil.
We are more or less 69,000 workers in the Mondragon corporation.
And the turnover is more less than 10,200 million euros per year.
One of the cooperatives is my cooperatives is Mondragon headquarters.
I am member, worker owner of the headquarters.
Because cooperatives are autonomous, they have their own general services, their own staff.
Cooperatives are a kind of companies that are friends and they are together in the group in the Mondragon corporation.
This is Oltalora, our training center, cooperative and management training center.
So managers of Mondragon come here to learn about negotiation, creativity, coaching.
And our members, they come here to know more about what is a cooperative, what are the values, the way to work in a cooperative.
Cooperatives are companies. It is about solidarity and about business.
So we invest every year a lot of money in innovation.
We're here for a week long immersive symposium co-hosted by our friend Georgia Kelly at the Praxis Peace Institute.
companies that make up the Mondragon system.
Cooperatives are companies.
It is about solidarity and about business.
we have to be competitive.
The only way to continue existing is innovation.
co-hosted by our friend Georgia Kelly at the Praxis Peace Institute.
Georgia has been on the Y-Earth Community podcast already talking about Mondragon.
to record at this beautiful setting, Otterlora.
